cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 575 miles SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest toward the North Carolina coast, expected to slow, then drift west across the Carolinas and eventually turn northward through the Appalachians and Mid-Atlantic interior

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the NC/VA border to Cape Charles Light, VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Duck NC, Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds (Hurricane & Storm-Surge Warnings); north of Duck NC to NC/VA border (Tropical-Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact expected along the North Carolina and South Carolina coasts, with heavy rain extending into the Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Low risk of tropical-storm-force winds (≤5% chance); occasional gusts with on-shore flow
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, mainly elevated surf and tides below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 3-6 in of rain Sun–Mon as remnant moisture moves north
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along New Jersey and Long Island beaches
